etymology.description: 送 (to send) + 秋波 ('autumn waves' = alluring, limpid eyes) = to cast flirtatious glances.
etymology.interpretation: Uses the classical image 秋波 for bright, watery eyes; pairing it with 送 conveys 'sending' a glance as a subtle signal of affection or flirtation.

parts.english: to send; to deliver; to present; to see off
autumn waves; limpid eyes; flirtatious glance; alluring look

examples.chinese: 她隔着酒杯向他送秋波(她隔著酒杯向他送秋波)。
examples.pinyin: Tā gézhe jiǔbēi xiàng tā sòng qiūbō.
examples.english: She sent him an amorous glance over her wine glass.

examples.chinese: 男主角只要一笑(男主角只要一笑)，粉丝们就对他送秋波(粉絲們就對他送秋波)。
examples.pinyin: Nán zhǔjiǎo zhǐyào yí xiào, fěnsīmen jiù duì tā sòng qiūbō.
examples.english: Whenever the male lead smiles, the fans throw him flirtatious glances.

examples.chinese: 她不言不语(她不言不語)，只用眼神向他送秋波(只用眼神向他送秋波)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù yán bù yǔ, zhǐ yòng yǎnshén xiàng tā sòng qiūbō.
examples.english: She said nothing, using only her eyes to send him a flirty glance.
